briefdescription.para: Default constructor with an optional parameter for the geometric traits object.

detaileddescription.para: Initializes a triangulation and then inserts the points in the iterator range [first, last).

briefdescription.para: Deletes all faces and vertices of the triangulation, and re-initializes the triangulation data structure with the set of dummy points.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &p, OutputFaceIterator it, Face_handle start=Face_handle(), Hyperbolic_translation ltr=Hyperbolic_translation()) const
memberdef.name: find_conflicts

briefdescription.para: Computes the conflict zone induced by p.

detaileddescription.para: The output iterator it contains all faces in conflict with p. The optional parameters start and ltr, if given, must be such that start translated by ltr is in conflict with p.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the vertex vh is part of the set of vertices storing dummy points.
Returns the number of dummy points currently existing in the triangulation.
Checks the combinatorial validity of the triangulation, and also the validity of its geometric embedding.

detaileddescription.para:
In more detail, this function verifies that:
The underlying triangulation data structure, is valid (see the function is_valid())
Each face of the triangulation is positively oriented and has the Delaunay property.
The Euler relation for genus-2 surfaces is satisfied, i.e., $V-E+F = -2$, where $V, E, F$ are the number of vertices, edges and faces of the triangulation, respectively.

briefdescription.para: Inserts the point p in the triangulation.

detaileddescription.para: The face start, if given, is used as a starting place for the location of the point. Note that this function does not remove unnecessary dummy points. The removal, if desired, should be done by manually calling the function try_to_remove_dummy_vertices().

memberdef.argsstring: (InputIterator first, InputIterator last, const bool flag_try_to_remove_dummy_vertices=true)
memberdef.name: insert

briefdescription.para: Inserts all points in the input iterator into the triangulation.

detaileddescription.para: Note that this function by default tries to remove unnecessary dummy points at the end of the insertion process. This behavior is controlled by the optional boolean parameter flag_try_to_remove_dummy_vertices; if automatic removal of the dummy points is not desired, set the flag to false.

briefdescription.para: Removes the vertex v from the triangulation.

detaileddescription.para: Note that v is removed from the triangulation only if the resulting triangulation remains a simplicial complex. The function returns true if the vertex v is removed from the triangulation, otherwise it returns false.

briefdescription.para: Removes the vertices in the iterator range [first, last) from the triangulation.

simplesect.para: all vertices in [first, last) are vertices of the triangulation.

briefdescription.para: Tries to remove the dummy points from the triangulation one by one.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of dummy points that could not be removed and are still present in the triangulation.

briefdescription.para: Returns the dual of face f, i.e., the hyperbolic center of the disk defined by the vertices of f.

detaileddescription.para: If the optional parameter nbtr is given, then this function returns the dual of the periodic triangle (f, nbtr).

briefdescription.para: Returns the hyperbolic segment that is dual to the edge e.
The class Periodic_4_hyperbolic_Delaunay_triangulation_2 enables the construction and handling of Delaunay triangulations of the Bolza surface.

detaileddescription.para: The class expects two template parameters.

parameterdescription.para: Geometric Traits parameter. Must be a model of the concept Periodic_4HyperbolicDelaunayTriangulationTraits_2. The default value for this parameter is Periodic_4_hyperbolic_Delaunay_triangulation_traits_2<>.

Triangulation Data Structure parameter. Must be a model of the concept TriangulationDataStructure_2 with some additional functionality in the vertices and faces, following the concepts Periodic_4HyperbolicTriangulationVertexBase_2 and Periodic_4HyperbolicTriangulationFaceBase_2, respectively. The default value for this parameter is CGAL::Triangulation_data_structure_2< CGAL::Periodic_4_hyperbolic_triangulation_vertex_base_2<GT>, CGAL::Periodic_4_hyperbolic_triangulation_face_base_2<GT>>
